{"step_by_step_thinking": "The height of contour refers to the point on a tooth where the greatest convexity or bulge is present. In general, the height of contour is located at the cervical third of the tooth. When comparing the maxillary central incisor and maxillary canine, we can observe that the canine is more tapered and has a more pronounced cusp compared to the central incisor. This means that the height of contour on the maxillary canine is generally higher than that of the maxillary central incisor. Therefore, the answer is A. More.", "answer_choice": "A"}
